alert.note: Alert for Pima; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 17 at 3:27PM MST until August 17 at 4:30PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tucson has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Northeastern Pima County in southeastern Arizona... South central Pinal County in southeastern Arizona... * Until 430 PM MST. * At 327 PM MST, a dust channel was near Marana, moving north at 5 mph. HAZARD...Less than one half mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Detected by National Weather Service meteorologists. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 227 and 251. Route 77 between mile markers 75 and 77. Locations impacted include... Oro Valley, Marana, Casas Adobes, Flowing Wells, Avra Valley, Tortolita, Saguaro National Park West, Tucson Estates, Picture Rocks, Red Rock and Dove Mountain. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
